SEARCH
Package algorithms.imageProcessing

Class ColorHistogram

java.lang.Object
algorithms.imageProcessing.ColorHistogram
public class ColorHistogram extends Object
NOTE: instead of this class, consider using a polar theta of cie luv to better cover the distribution of colors.
Author:
nichole

  • Method Details

    • histogram

      public int[][] histogram(Image img, Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> points)
      histogram of 16 bins each of r' = r/(r+g+b) and g' = g/(r+g+b).
      Parameters:
      img -
      points -
      Returns:
      histogram accessed as hist[0][bin] and hist[1][bin] where 0 is for r' histogram and 1 is for the g' histogram.

    • add2To1

      public void add2To1(int[][] hist1, int[][] hist2)

    • add2To1

      public void add2To1(int[] hist1, int[] hist2)

    • histogramCIELAB

      public int[][] histogramCIELAB(ImageExt img, Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> points)
      histogram of 16 bins each of CIE LAB colors where the bins of each color are taken to be in the range of min and max possible values 
          L    0 to 28.5
    A  -46.9  62.5
    B  -45.7  48.0
      Parameters:
      img -
      points -
      Returns:
      histogram accessed as hist[0][bin] and hist[1][bin] and hist[2][bin] where 0, 1, 2 are histograms for L, A, and B, respectively using a range of values (0,-50,-50) to (28.5 62.5 48.0) and 16 bins.

    • histogramCIELAB

      public int[][] histogramCIELAB(ImageExt img, gnu.trove.list.TIntList xPoints, gnu.trove.list.TIntList yPoints)
      histogram of 16 bins each of CIE LAB colors where the bins of each color are taken to be in the range of min and max possible values 
          L    0 to 28.5
    A  -46.9  62.5
    B  -45.7  48.0
      Parameters:
      img -
      Returns:
      histogram accessed as hist[0][bin] and hist[1][bin] and hist[2][bin] where 0, 1, 2 are histograms for L, A, and B, respectively using a range of values (0,-50,-50) to (28.5 62.5 48.0) and 16 bins.

    • histogramCIELUV

      public int[][] histogramCIELUV(Image img, Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> points)
      histogram of 16 bins each of CIE LUV colors where the bins of each color are taken to be in the range of min and max possible values 
       range of return values when using default standard illumination of
 D65 daylight is:
 L       0 to 104.5
 u   -86.9 to 183.8
 v  -141.4 to 112.3
      Parameters:
      img -
      points -
      Returns:
      histogram accessed as hist[0][bin] and hist[1][bin] and hist[2][bin] where 0, 1, 2 are histograms for L, A, and B, respectively using a range of values and 16 bins.

    • histogramCIELAB

      public int[][] histogramCIELAB(ImageExt img, gnu.trove.set.TIntSet points)
      histogram of 16 bins each of CIE LAB colors where the bins of each color are taken to be in the range of min and max possible values, range of values (0,-50,-50) to (28.5 62.5 48.0).
      Parameters:
      img -
      points -
      Returns:
      histogram accessed as hist[0][bin] and hist[1][bin] and hist[2][bin] where 0, 1, 2 are histograms for L, A, and B, respectively using a range of values range of values (0,-50,-50) to (28.5 62.5 48.0) and 16 bins.

    • histogramCIECH64

      public int[] histogramCIECH64(ImageExt img, Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> points)
      histogram of CIE LUV C and H which are the polar angle of U,V and the magnitude. The histogram is a one dimensional binning of divisions of C and H in combination. 8 divisions in C or H results in 64 bins, for example. The ranges of the bins are the ranges from use of the D65 standard illuminant which are 
       * L* 0 to 105
 c  0 to 139
 h  0 to 359
      Parameters:
      img -
      points -
      Returns:
      histogram of CIE LUV C and H which are the polar angle of U,V and the magnitude. The histogram is a one dimensional binning of divisions of C and H in combination. 8 divisions in C or H results in 64 bins, for example.

    • histogramCIECH64

      public int[] histogramCIECH64(ImageExt img, gnu.trove.list.TIntList xPoints, gnu.trove.list.TIntList yPoints)
      histogram of CIE LUV C and H which are the polar angle of U,V and the magnitude. The histogram is a one dimensional binning of divisions of C and H in combination. 8 divisions in C or H results in 64 bins, for example. The ranges of the bins are the ranges from use of the D65 standard illuminant which are 
       * L* 0 to 105
 c  0 to 139
 h  0 to 359
      Parameters:
      img -
      Returns:
      histogram of CIE LUV C and H which are the polar angle of U,V and the magnitude. The histogram is a one dimensional binning of divisions of C and H in combination. 8 divisions in C or H results in 64 bins, for example.

      points -
      Returns:

      Parameters:
      values - from 0 to maxV, inclusive
      Returns:

    • createPTHistograms

      public static List<algorithms.util.OneDIntArray> createPTHistograms(GreyscaleImage ptImg, List<gnu.trove.set.TIntSet> labeledSets)
      ptImg values for histogram bins: 0: red = 0 - 18 1: orange = 18 - 40 2: yellow = 41 - 60ish 3: green = 61 - 106 4: blue = 107 - 192 5: purple = 193 - 255
      Parameters:
      ptImg - , the "H" image of LCH color space
      labeledSets -
      Returns:
